processes.title: SPM
processes.name: Service portfolio management
processes.objective: To define and maintain a service portfolio

processes.title: SLM
processes.name: Service Level Management
processes.objective: To maintain a service catalogue, and to define, agree and monitor service levels with customers by establishing meaningful service level agreements (SLAs) and supportive operational level (OLAs) and underpinning agreements (UAs) with suppliers.

processes.title: CRM
processes.name: Customer Relationship Management
processes.objective: To establish and maintain a good relationship with customers receiving services

processes.title: SUPPM
processes.name: Supplier Relationship Management
processes.objective: To establish and maintain a healthy relationship with suppliers supporting the service provider in delivering services to customers, and monitor their performance

processes.title: SACM
processes.name: Service Availability and Continuity Management
processes.objective: To ensure sufficient service availability to meet agreed requirements and adequate service

processes.title: CAPM
processes.name: Capacity Management
processes.objective: To ensure sufficient capacities are provided to meet agreed service capacity and performance requirements

processes.title: CONFM
processes.name: Configuraiton Management
processes.objective: To provide and maintain a logical model of all configuration items (CIs) and their relationships and dependencies

processes.title: CHM
processes.name: Change Management
processes.objective: To ensure changes to CIs are planned, approved, implemented and reviewed in a controlled to avoid adverse impact of changes to services or the customers receiving services

processes.title: RDM
processes.name: Release and Deployment Management
processes.objective: To bundle changes of one or more CIs to releases, so that these changes can be tested  deployed to the live environment together

processes.title: ISRM
processes.name: Incident and Service Request Management
processes.objective: To restore normal / agreed service operation within the agreed time after the occurrence of an incident, and to respond to user service requests

processes.title: PM
processes.name: Problem Management
processes.objective: To investigate the root causes of (recurring) incidents in order to avoid future recurrence of incidents by resolving the underlying cause, or to ensure workarounds or temporary fixes are available

processes.title: SRM
processes.name: Service Reporting Management
processes.objective: To specify all service reports and ensure they are produced according to specifications in a timely manner to support decision-making

processes.title: CSI
processes.name: Continual Service Improvement Management
processes.objective: To identify, prioritize, plan, implement and review improvements to services and service management

processes.title: ISM
processes.name: Information Security Management
processes.objective: To manage information security effectively through all activities performed to deliver and manage services, so that the confidentiality, integrity and accessibility of relevant information are preserved
